channel.title: CVE Feed for GeoVision -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for GeoVision -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-3928|2024-09-17T01:21:32.177Z -- geovision -- door%20access%20control%20device
item.description: GeoVision Door Access Control device family is hardcoded with a root password, which adopting an identical password in all devices.

item.title: CVE-2020-3929|2024-09-17T02:26:42.600Z -- geovision -- door%20access%20control%20device
item.description: GeoVision Door Access Control device family employs shared cryptographic private keys for SSH and HTTPS. Attackers may conduct MITM attack with the derived keys and plaintext recover of encrypted messages.

item.title: CVE-2024-6047|2024-07-17T07:33:54.631Z -- geovision -- gv_dsp_lpr_v2
item.description: Certain EOL GeoVision devices fail to properly filter user input for the specific functionality. Unauthenticated remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary system commands on the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-6047|2024-06-17T05:48:42.779Z -- geovision -- gv_dsp_lpr_v2
item.description: Certain EOL GeoVision devices fail to properly filter user input for the specific functionality. Unauthenticated remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary system commands on the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-6047|2024-06-17T14:06:47.780Z -- geovision -- gv_dsp_lpr_v2
item.description: Certain EOL GeoVision devices fail to properly filter user input for the specific functionality. Unauthenticated remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary system commands on the device.
